sentences.english: This is no doubt meant to slander and defile money.
sentences.chinese: 這無疑是對金錢的污衊與栽贓。

sentences.english: F. I saw his video which is an embarrasment to the world of arch.
sentences.chinese: 我看過他的錄像，簡直是對考古學的污衊。

sentences.english: She turned as red as a beetroot when they befouled her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他們污衊她時，她滿臉緋紅。

sentences.english: On the other side, there were those who branded them as the “curse” of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，又有人污衊他們是這個國家的“禍根”。
有些則完全是污衊性的。

sentences.english: The accusations, the persecution caused him so much financial and mental anguish.
sentences.chinese: 控告和污衊帶給他如此多的經濟和精神上的痛苦。

sentences.english: Thanksgiving slander you, is that they let you know sweep before your own door.
sentences.chinese: 感恩污衊你的人，是他們讓你知道正人先正己。

definition: to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
